alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 2:19PM CDT until September 08 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jefferson Davis Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Calcasieu Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 245 PM CDT. * At 219 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deweyville to near Thornwell, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Orange, Westlake, Vinton, Iowa, Lake Arthur, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Starks, Hayes, Moss Bluff, Carlyss, Lunita, Toomey, Edgerly, Thornwell, Holmwood, Hackberry, Bell City, and Lacassine. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 44. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
